description: Mobile techniques used by Anubis, ATT&CK software S0422 v1.2
name: Anubis (S0422)

techniques.comment: [Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can steal the device’s contact list.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can collect a list of installed applications to compare to a list of targeted applications.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can record phone calls and audio, and can make phone calls.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) exfiltrates data encrypted (with RC4) by its ransomware module.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can use its ransomware module to encrypt device data and hold it for ransom.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)

[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can exfiltrate files encrypted with the ransomware module from the device and can modify external storage.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)(Citation: Trend Micro Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) has been delivered via the Google Play Store.(Citation: Trend Micro Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) was distributed via phishing link in an email.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can download attacker-specified APK files.(Citation: Trend Micro Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) has used motion sensor data  to attempt to determine if it is running in an emulator.(Citation: Trend Micro Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) has a keylogger that works in every application installed on the device.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can create overlays to capture user credentials for targeted applications.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can modify administrator settings and disable Play Protect.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can retrieve the device’s GPS location.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)

[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) has requested accessibility service privileges while masquerading as "Google Play Protect" and has disguised additional malicious application installs as legitimate system updates.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)(Citation: Trend Micro Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can collect a list of running processes.(Citation: Zimperium z9)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can take screenshots.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can send, receive, and delete SMS messages.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can collect the device’s ID.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)
[Anubis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0422) can retrieve the C2 address from Twitter and Telegram.(Citation: Cofense Anubis)(Citation: Trend Micro Anubis)
